info.title: ChartFox API Documentation
info.description: API documentation for the ChartFox API.

tags.name: Airports
tags.description: Endpoints for searching and viewing airports

tags.name: Charts
tags.description: Endpoints for getting details and files for charts

tags.name: Interfaces
tags.description: Endpoints for getting embeddable interfaces that can be used in your own site in an iframe

tags.name: OAuth User Data
tags.description: Endpoints for access data associated with the OAuth User

AirportType.description:
> 
* `Closed` - closed
* `SmallAirport` - small_airport
* `MediumAirport` - medium_airport
* `LargeAirport` - large_airport
* `SeaplaneBase` - seaplane_base
* `Heliport` - heliport
* `BaloonPort` - balloonport

ident.description: Primary identifier for the airport. Typically ICAO code

type.description: [NULLABLE] Enum describing the type of airport. Allowed Values: closed (Closed), small_airport (SmallAirport), medium_airport (MediumAirport), large_airport (LargeAirport), seaplane_base (SeaplaneBase), heliport (Heliport), balloonport (BaloonPort)

iso_a2_country.description: [NULLABLE] The ISO 2 Alpha country code that the airport resides in

has_charts.description: Whether the airport has charts available

has_sources.description: Whether the airport has sources available

airport_icao.description: ICAO code of the airport the chart belongs to

type.description: Enum describing the chart's type. Allowed Values: 0 (Unknown), 1 (General), 2 (Textual), 3 (GroundLayout), 4 (SID), 5 (STAR), 6 (Approach), 7 (Transition), 99 (Briefing)

has_georeferences.description: [NULLABLE] Whether the chart has geo references

airport_icao.description: ICAO code of the airport the chart belongs to

type.description: Enum describing the chart's type. Allowed Values: 0 (Unknown), 1 (General), 2 (Textual), 3 (GroundLayout), 4 (SID), 5 (STAR), 6 (Approach), 7 (Transition), 99 (Briefing)

view_url.description: [NULLABLE] URL to view the chart in ChartFox

source_url.description: [NULLABLE] URL of the chart at the supplier (if available)

source_url_type.description: [NULLABLE] Enum describing the type of the source url. Allowed Values: 0 (PDF), 1 (IMG), 2 (HTML)

source_uuid.description: [NULLABLE] Identifier that uniquely describes this chart at the supplier

type.description: Enum describing the type of meta. Allowed Values: 0 (Runways), 1 (ProcedureIdent), 2 (ProcedureType)

type_key.description: String representation of the enum type

value.description: The value of the meta data

requires_preauth.description: [NULLABLE] Whether the chart requires special pre-authorisation before the URL can be viewed (e.g. disclaimer acceptance)

allows_iframe.description: [NULLABLE] Whether the chart allows for iframing

has_georeferences.description: [NULLABLE] Whether the chart has geo references

source.description: [NULLABLE] String describing the source of the telemetry

next_update.description: The time of the next expected telemetry update. This is computed dynamically, based on the information source

default.description: You can retrieve a token either: Via OAuth (if enabled for your organisation); or by generating a PAT in your organisation.

get.description:
Lists all airports matching any given search parameters. Returns a paginated response.

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *airports:view*

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: String to search by. The airport name and ICAO code will be matched with this parameter.

schema.description: String to search by. The airport name and ICAO code will be matched with this parameter.

parameters.name: identQuery
parameters.description: Search query for a full or partial airport ICAO/IATA code.

schema.description: Search query for a full or partial airport ICAO/IATA code.

parameters.name: nameQuery
parameters.description: Search query for the airport name code.

schema.description: Search query for the airport name code.

parameters.name: isoCountry
parameters.description: Search by the airport's country ISO Alpha 2 code (e.g. for the UK it would be "GB").

schema.description: Search by the airport's country ISO Alpha 2 code (e.g. for the UK it would be "GB").

parameters.name: supported
parameters.description: Filter by whether to only show airports that are supported (either have a source or have charts).

schema.description: Filter by whether to only show airports that are supported (either have a source or have charts).

parameters.name: idents[]
parameters.description: List of idents to filter by

schema.description: List of idents to filter by

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description: List of ids to filter by

schema.description: List of ids to filter by

identQuery.description: Must contain only letters. Must not be greater than 4 characters.

isoCountry.description: Must contain only letters. Must be 2 characters.

get.description:
Provides basic information about a single airport

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *airports:view*

Provides a list of charts available for the airport. The details for a chart can then be loaded with the /charts/ endpoint(s).

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *charts:index*

Provides a dictionary of charts, grouped by type, for the airport. The dictionary keys are Chart Type enums

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *charts:index*

Provides detailed chart information, including how to access it

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *charts:view* 


 **Optional Token Scopes**: 
 - *charts:files* If the token has this ability and the chart has them, first-party hosted mirrors of the chart will be included
 - *charts:geos* If the token has this ability and the chart has them, geo-referencing data will be included for the chart
 - *charts:view_source_url* If the token has this ability, the direct URL to view the chart is included

Provides a 'lite' verison of the ChartFox application, complete with chart filtering and displaying.

Because this is a client-side API method and it uses iframes, to authenticate with this method
**you must** provide your API token in the query string (e.g. ?token={YOUR TOKEN HERE})

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *interface:airportCharts*

Retrieve details about the current authenticated user

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *oauth:user:name*

Access OAuth user's flight simulator telemetry, if any is available.

 **Requried Token Scopes**: 
 - *oauth:telemetry:view*

example.message: No telemetry currently available for this user

latitude.description: Must be at least -90. Must not be greater than 90.

longitude.description: Must be at least -180. Must not be greater than 180.

heading.description: Must be at least 0. Must not be greater than 360.

speed.description: Must be at least 0. Must not be greater than 1500.
